titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Beauford Delaney Letter to Charles Nagel, 1967 February 16, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Jayna M. Josefson
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for the processing of this collection was provided by the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-23 12:43:02 -0500.

did.unittitle: Beauford Delaney letter to Charles Nagel
did.abstract: Found here is one letter to museum director Charles Nagel written by artist Beauford Delaney, dated February 16th, 1967. In this letter, Beauford Delaney thanks Charles Nagel for his kindness to artists. Delaney also mentions Madame Breeskin [Adelyn Breeskin].

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Beauford Delaney (1901-1979) was an African American painter known for his association with the Harlem Renaissance and his works in abstract expressionism after his move to Paris in 1953. Charles Nagel, Jr. (1899-1922) was an architect and museum director.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Due to the small size of this collection the papers are arranged as one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Found here is one letter to museum director Charles Nagel written by artist Beauford Delaney, dated February 16th, 1967. In this letter, Beauford Delaney thanks Charles Nagel for his kindness to artists. Delaney also mentions Madame Breeskin [Adelyn Breeskin].

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Contact Reference Services for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred in 2005 from Smithsonian American Art Museum. Provenance unknown.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Beauford Delaney letter to Charles Nagel, 1967 February 16. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed, and a finding aid prepared by Jayna Josefson in 2021.
